defaultQuestions.question: Where do I find readiness information?
What do I need for medical clearance?

defaultFAQ.question: How do I check my medical requirements?
defaultFAQ.answer: Access your IMR from the Air Force portal. https://asimsimr.health.mil/imr/myimr.aspx

defaultFAQ.question: I’ve been hurt while on orders, what is the next step?
defaultFAQ.answer: If you were hurt during drill/AT orders get seen at Tripler ED on the day you were hurt. If you were hurt during AGR/MPA orders get seen at schedule an appointment with 15th MDG or go to Tripler ED for emergencies. Email 154MDG.GCC@us.af.mil for an LOD form only if you require follow-up care/surgery for an injury after your orders end date.

defaultFAQ.question: How do I get a profile for duty/fitness restrictions?
defaultFAQ.answer: DSG: Please have your provider fill out a Request Medical Information (RMI) and submit to 154th MDG. (attach general RMI form) AGR/MPA: Schedule an appointment with your PCM at the 15th MDG.

defaultFAQ.question: I’ve been selected for an AGR/MPA tour, how do I get medical clearance?
defaultFAQ.answer: Please ensure your IMR is GREEN. Send your AGR/MPA checklist to 154MDG.GCC@us.af.mil. Your unit should provide you with a checklist, medical does not provide a checklist. Medical clearance is an AF422 that we will create for you if you do not have one dated within 12 months.

defaultFAQ.question: I am due for my FLY physical; how do I schedule an appointment?
defaultFAQ.answer: Complete your PHAQ on your MyIMR and then contact your Unit Health Monitor to schedule your appointment or you may call 808-789-0184 or email 154MDG.GCC@us.af.mil to schedule.

defaultFAQ.question: How do I get a copy of my DD2992?
How often do I need to do my FLY physical?
How often do I need to do my dental?
defaultFAQ.answer: DSG: Every 12 months with your civilian dental and submit your DD Form 2813 to 154mdg.gcc@us.af.mil. AGR/MPA: Every 12 months with 15th Dental Clinic.

defaultFAQ.question: How do I schedule an appointment for something on my action list?
defaultFAQ.answer: Notify your Unit Health Monitor or email our org box 154mdg.gcc@us.af.mil.

defaultFAQ.question: How do I know what I am medically due for?
How do I start my PHAQ?
Why am I still showing due for PHA/MHA?
defaultFAQ.answer: You still need to complete your MHA (with QTC), once MHA is completed our providers will sign off during drill weekends. Email 154mdg.gcc@us.af.mil if needed for promotion/tour/deployment.

defaultFAQ.question: I’ve recently been tasked to deploy. How can I schedule an appointment to complete my medical requirements?
defaultFAQ.answer: Contact your UDM to coordinate an appointment with the Medical group.

defaultFAQ.question: How often do I update my shop roster as a supervisor?
How often do I need to complete an audiogram?
Who do I contact if my audiogram is not updated in ASIMS?
What happens if I fail my annual audiogram?
defaultFAQ.answer: You are required to complete a 14-hour noise free follow-up 1 audiogram the next day.

defaultFAQ.question: What happens if I fail My 14-hour noise free follow up 1 audiogram?
defaultFAQ.answer: You are required to complete a same day follow up 2 audiogram.

defaultFAQ.question: What happens when I Fail my same day follow-up 2 audiogram?
defaultFAQ.answer: You are required to complete a DD1753 form and a face-to-face ear exam with a provider to determine if you need an audiologist referral or re-established baseline.
